Игра просто классная, большое спасибо разработчикам. И не менее важно что это единственная корпорация которая думает о игрококах а не думая в первую очередь о игре. Сюжет просто классный, настолько эмонациональный, что за душу берет. Эту игру я считаю великой сагой которая будет жить и жить в серцах милионов людей, которых становится все больше и больше с каждый днем, нет с каждой секундой.

Гейб, ты выпустил шедевр, мы ждем великого продолжения вселенно Half-Life! секунду за секундой, минута за минутой, час за часом, день за днем, месяц за месяцем, год за годом, век за веком, большой взрыв за большим взрывом, знай Гейб, продолжение будут ждать бесчиссленное множество поклоников, великой, необъятной вселенной Half-Life! Гейб, ты сотворил Half-Life Гейб, "...нужный человек не в том месте может перевернуть мир.". Великая цитата исходящая из уст не раскрытого G-Man. Но Гейб оказался именно в том месте и перевернул мир! Гейб Мы Верим в тебя! Ждем 3!

Gabe, you released a masterpiece, we are waiting for a great continuation of the universe Half-Life! second by second, minute by minute, hour by hour, day after day, month after month, year after year, century after century, the big bang of the big bang, know Gabe, continued be glad beschisslennoe lot of aficionados, the great, vast universe Half- Life! Gabe, you made Half-Life Gabe, "... the right man in the wrong place can change the world.". Great quote from the mouth not disclosed G-Man. But Gabe was exactly in the place and turned the world! Gabe We believe in you!

Valveが開発したFPS。超有名FPS「ハーフライフ」の続編に当たる。
ゲーム内容の説明を超簡単にすると、プレイヤーはゴードン・フリーマン博士を操作し、
レジスタンスとして、支配者のコンバインの兵士やブリーン博士との戦いに身を投じる。
シングルモードに加えて、マルチモードもある（ただし別個の作品として購入する必要がある）
Sourceエンジンを使用したMODの開発が非常に盛んであり、
無料で公開されてるものがたくさん有る。
ゲームの後は自分でゲーム制作も出来る。

Half Life 2, one of the BEST Games ever made. The Story of one of the most inspiring Characters of shooters ever comes, back, Dr. Gordon Freeman. Half Life 2 gives you about 18 to 24 Hours of Gameplay, maybe more with the Addition of Episodes One and Two.
Its totally worth a buy.

Cool FPS with some physics, action, and story.  However I feel it is over-rated.  I outsmarted the AI at every turn, cheated every super robot machine/helicopter, and attempted to break the game during every story sequence.  Perhaps I missed the boat on this, but its an awesome FPS/Story game, but I just felt like I was running a rat maze and cheese was at the end.  No branches, few pathways, just running down the hallways, tunnels, and walkways.  Overall good, but I feel over-rated.
bueno, aunque predecible. Se pasan unas buenas horas jugando a salvar el mundo...
nice game 10 / 10

Never will a Valve game immerse you in its story as quickly and pleasantly as this. Love this game. It's a game that I played through once, loved it, found myself quoting characters in the weeks following, and decided to play again a year later. I don't know why but you feel really cool but really smart at the same time when you play the character. If you are an avid Steam gamer, you must consider getting this game.
Epic.
Kill evil men with strange masks, funny looking zombies, headcrabs, barnacles, striders, antlions, gunships

Play the game that started with the source engine, Half-Life 2. The physics of this game will blow you away. You play as a scientist named Gordon Freeman. As you play this game, you'll come across many challenges, puzzles, enemies, and friends. An excellent FPS game that comes with ton of guns, explosives, and a mysterious weapon. Half-Life 2 will not disappoint you.
Incredibly awesome fps that turned me into a BELIEVER!!!
Melhor jogo em que o Jesus já deixou alguma produtora fazer... Obrigado Valve!

this is steam so i imagine this wont be read by anyone who doesnt have this already, but...

Must...play...game. The only bad thing about this game at the time of release was the inclusion of steam (i had dial up at the time, and the required updates took so long that i think it took 2 days after release for me to be able to actually play this game). but even steam turned out awesome in the end, so there is literally nothing bad i can say about this game. I still come back to this and run thru a few levels or so every few months.

if you havent yet, you must.
De Facto Game of this generation. A must have.
Rise and shine Mr. Freeman, rise and shine... The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world. So, wake up, Mr. Freeman, wake up and smell the ashes...

This game is a masterpiece, if you ever wanted to find a classic, this is the game for you, I've played through this game many times, and each time is still extremely fun. The soviet-biopunk art style is to die for, however the graphics have aged like milk in some spots despite being revolutionary in their heyday. But where the graphics fall short, the game play brings it back. All of the guns are a blast to use, especially the gravity gun, the city and citadel levels are awesome. The characters, while at times have very, very cheesy jokes, are well developed and believable. The music, and sound effects are awesome, although sadly some of the ambient sounds are highly compressed, so much so that it's noticeable, which kind of sucks.

-Graphics 5/10
-Art Style 10/10
-Gameplay 9/10
-SFX 7/10
-Music 9/10
-Sequal 2/3

An epic game; with a twisted story, good puzzles, plenty of killing... and running for your life. Even if you haven't played the first one don't let that stop you because this game is just fun. They really went over the top creating a world that is truely fascinating.

Most of my other recommendations are fairly long, this one's not. If you're a PC gamer, and you don't own this game, shame on you. By the time you finish the game, and the episodes, who knows, Episode 3 or HL3 might be right around the corner...

The first fps i played was heretic. and i thought "wow" as a little kid. The next game i played that i fell in love with, but wasnt in aw. Was duke nukem64. I wouldnt be in such amazingment until years later. 2007.(3 years after this was released.) That i would be in jaw dropping astonishment at this game. And how far games have come. I remember even 2007 i didnt have the right hardware to play this game on max settings. barely recommended. I would play on low textures. and i had lag, and image tearing. but i was still so shocked. and amazed and i loved it. i had never seen anything like it. anyway. when i would go to work after playing it. i would assimilate real life to halflife 2. i would be at work, and i would be like. dood! i feel like im playing half life 2. it was so real to me. and the physics. Its dated now ofcourse. 7yrs old. but i still play it. and love it. it still has beautiful settings. i love this game.
Fidati di uno che li ha provati tutti, ma HALF LIFE 2 è il migliore!

Like Half-Life before it, if you haven't played this yet you really ought to. The story is an awesome take on the classic invasion theme. There is some wonderful voice acting (The late Robert Culp is a brilliant actor in this. Especially when voicing the Dr. Breen propaganda reels you'll come across). The stages do a great job in adding the right tone in the right situation to give you the feeling you're the hero in a movie about a dystopian future. Puzzles break up action sequences as in the original game, but they're usually not overly lengthy,  or difficult.   Like I said about HL, you should pick this up, it's expansions (The story alone will make you want them), or the orange box.
Then join the rest of the world in clamoring for Half Life 3

"This is it." Those are the words you'll be saying or feeling in your mind when playing Half-Life 2. I was feeling this during each of the ten playthroughs of this magnum opus of Valve. The best game I have ever played.

Its fear of the unknown atmosphere and fascinating story reach stellar quality levels. This game collects all the great things that matter in video games and expands them to extremely high levels of polishment, epicness, and pure awesomeness. The result is perfect gameplay, perfect graphics, perfect audio, everything quite perfect, abundant in extreme quality, which you will never forget — one of the most outstanding achievements of the video game industry.

I don't know what to add. Even when I replayed this game for the tenth or so time, I had a wonderful time. Thanks to its perfectly utilized physics engine, the game has a believable world overflowing with interactivity. The Gravity Gun is one of the best weapons/tools of all time. Every second modern game has some player physics interaction and maybe even some sort of telekinesis ability. Still, I have yet to witness such seamless implementation like the Gravity Gun of Half-Life 2. This game also possesses a unique, exotic, and other-worldly soundtrack of the highest appeal that I always like to listen to from time to time. Plus, I will never forget the voice of the Overwatch and all the other amazing iconic sounds of this masterpiece.

[b][u] 10/10 [/u][/b]

Half Life 2 - The game that you simply must play.

You play as Gorden Freeman a scientist/Army Hero guy who is employed through a ambiguous character known as the "G-Man" who sell you to whoever is the highest bidder in most circumstances...

This is a FPS based game so has the usual controls, interesting unique weapons and some hidden gems.

So some backstory of why i love this game

From the Moment i first played Half Life all those years ago as a Demo i was hooked (wasnt lucky enough to play Day one).

The Game Play, Story, Visuals all made you go wow.

So Half Life 2 comes around and does it all again with a even better story, better graphics, Great sound and the list just goes on and on.

Yes sure there are open world games but when it comes down to it, this is a immersive well played out story that just needs to be played no bickering etc this is a pure classic

So if you have steam and do not own Half Life 2? Why the hell are you even on here?

This would have to be one of the best games of all time. 

Beautiful levels combined with great effort to make the game extremely imersive and wanting more which is where the the episodes come in.

This is and will remain for a long time as one of my all time favourites.
In 2010, PC Gamer named in a poll by its readers, that Half-Life 2 was considered the best game of all time.
A lovely, lovely game. Probably my favorite of all time.

Words cannot describe this game. It's just... too good. I can't write something comprehensive about it ^^. Jump back into the shoes of Gordon Freeman and try your best to fight back against the Combine. The gameplay is a blend of FPS, puzzles and action packed moments along with a lot of exploration. The source engine has been upgraded to make HL2 have more visual features, the motion and movements of the characters during interation is amazing, the world is lifelike and pulls you into it and... well... Valve have made one of the greatest PC games of all time. Half-Life 2, I salute you. You are fantastic. *Salutes*
This is an epic FPS game through city 17. Gameplay is immense and fun. You have to have this!

If yer reading this, then I have to assume one of two possible reasons: either you think I'm gonna say something funny (nope) or you've never actually played this game... and that would make me sad. This game changed the entire genre of FPS when it came out by setting a new bar for what "good" meant when you talk about video games. The engine for this game was some sort of wierd little Valve secret before it came out because ti was so totally and completely amazing. The engine is still being used today with all sorts of new games. In the end all you need to know is that the price for this game is TOTALLY WORTH IT. I have personally played through this game 4 times. Why? Because its not about the graphics or the engine or the completely bug-free game... its about experiencing the story and plotline for me and there are few games that touch Half-Life 2's level of 'epic'.
Meh.  It's not the worst game in the world.
One of the best single player campaigns of all time. Would not recommend buying standalone though - buying it as part of the Valve complete pack or the orange box adds FAR more value.
Don't have it yet? Get moving and buy it!!! It's a MUST have.
One of the best games I've ever played - great story, challenging gameplay and a shitload of fun. ;)
Una narrativa envolvente, ación y gráficos de primera, aunque los puzzles no son tan difíciles de resolver

Have you ever been on an automated museum tour? Where you go down a hallway and periodically something pops out or lights up and a recording drones on about it for a bit?
Pretend you have to press a button before you can proceed to the next station and you've pretty much summed up Half-Life 2.

Perhaps it opens up or does something interesting later on, but I already played it far beyond when I was bored of it and that's all I got out of it. If it can't do something interesting before I get bored of it, it has failed no matter how good the rest may be.

If you still haven't played Half-Life 2, or Episode 1 or 2, and you like first-person shooters, then you should pick up the Orange Box the next time it's on sale. You get HL2, episode 1 and 2, Team Fortress 2 (which is great fun as a multiplayer team-based FPS with several distinct classes), and Portal, all of which are worth playing.

While you're playing HL2, be sure to imagine Gordon Freeman telepathically projecting his thoughts into the minds of the other characters - it is, after all, the only explanation for how they seem to know what he wants them to know without him actually saying anything, and without you hearing him speaking. Oddly, they don't seem to mind.
